seo.title: About SustainSage | Coaching built on trust
seo.description: Meet the ICF-aligned, multicultural coaches behind SustainSage. Learn how we practise, who we support, and how we stay accountable.

hero.title: Trust is built in how we practise
hero.body: We partner with people navigating relocation, career change, and mission-led work across cultures. Conversations stay bilingual, steady, and grounded.
bullets: Aligned with the ICF Code of Ethics from agreements to data care.
Lived experience relocating across Asia-Pacific, Europe, and the UK.
Practical, no-drama experiments that respect your agency.

inPractice.title: In practice, this means
inPractice.intro: When we coach together, you can count on a calm, transparent rhythm.
bullets: We slow down before jumping into action so your thinking can settle.
We ask before offering tools or frameworks, checking what fits your context.
We name limits early—we are not therapists, lawyers, or immigration advisers.
We document fees, cadence, and review points so decisions stay transparent.

founders.title: Founders
founders.intro: SustainSage is led by bilingual coaches who have built careers across continents while supporting newcomers, mission-driven teams, and leaders in transition.

people.name: Yi-Ling Lai 賴怡伶 (she/her)
people.role: Co-founder · ICF PCC coach & service designer
bio: ICF Professional Certified Coach and service designer with 15 years in Taipei, Singapore, and the UK tech/NGO sectors.
Helps new immigrants, bilingual managers, and social impact teams navigate cultural nuance with steady, values-led experiments.
Leads peer supervision circles for coaches of colour and integrates trauma-aware safeguarding training into every engagement.

people.name: Hao-Cheng Tsai 蔡皓丞 (he/him)
bio: Coach and facilitator with background in social innovation, civic tech, and humanitarian programmes across Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the UK.
Works with career shifters, NGO/tech leaders, and returning parents to translate values into realistic action plans.
Draws on his own migration journey to support clients building networks, resilience, and cross-cultural collaboration.

ethics.title: Ethics & supervision
ethics.intro: Accountability is built into our practice, so you always know what safeguards are in place.

items.title: ICF Code of Ethics
items.body: Every agreement, data practice, and session structure follows the International Coaching Federation Code of Ethics. We revisit it whenever scope or needs shift.

items.title: Regular supervision & peer reflection
items.body: We meet monthly with senior supervisors and facilitate peer reflection with multilingual practitioners to surface blind spots early.

items.title: When coaching isn't right
items.body: If coaching is not the right support, we pause and collaborate on referrals—signposting mental health, legal, immigration, or community resources.

cta.body: Explore concrete coaching pathways or read common questions before booking anything.
